column4: hi, how can I findout if there is something running in port 2000 please?
what do you mean.... listening on TCP port 5000? or UDP port 5000?  or something connecting from your machtine to port 5000 somewhere else?
thanks! nhmm I'm trying to install ofbiz and run tnameserv (Cordoba I think) on port 2000 but something must be using this port because it can't bind to port 2000, so I think is TCP listening
right... do 'netstat -ltn' to see what is listening on TCP ports on your machine
nothing on that port, so must be something else :/ tks :)
do 'netstat -ltnp' to see what program listening on what port ;--)
pou may need  'sudo netstat -ltnp'.... to see all processes etc.
I didnt know there was a -p until I just looked ;-)
true haha.. so many things to learn man! aaahh haha :)
do you know how to use a history command by it's id?
you mean a command in the bash shell ? I dont know what you mean
you can also use ctrl-r to help you.........
and start typing the beginning of a previous command.................
